definitions.definition: an excavation in the earth for extracting coal or other minerals.

examples: the book contains a mine of information

definitions.definition: a type of bomb placed on or just below the surface of the ground or in the water that detonates when disturbed by a person, vehicle, or ship.
examples: explosive, land mine, limpet mine, magnetic mine, depth charge he was killed by a mine

definitions.definition: a subterranean passage under the wall of a besieged fortress, especially one in which explosives are put to blow up fortifications.
obtain (coal or other minerals) from a mine.
examples: quarry, excavate, dig (up), extract, remove; Morestrip-mine, pan "the iron ore was mined from shallow pits"Morestrip-mine, pan the iron ore was mined from shallow pits

definitions.definition: dig in (the earth) for coal or other minerals.
examples: the hills were mined for copper oxide

definitions.definition: delve into (an abundant source) to extract something of value, especially information or skill.
examples: how do they manage to mine such a rich vein of talent?
synonyms: survey "medical data was mined for relevant statistics"

definitions.definition: lay explosive mines on or just below the surface of (the ground or water).
synonyms: lay with mines "the entrance to the harbor had been mined"

definitions.definition: destroy by means of an explosive mine.
